content.text: 1 cup white sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 cup white sugar" )

content.text: 1 cup water
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 cup water" )

content.text: 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons orange flower water
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "2 tablespoons orange flower water" )

content.text: 2 cups all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "2 cups all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "2 tablespoons vegetable oil" )

content.text: 1 egg
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 egg" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice" )

content.text: 1 pinch salt
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "1 pinch salt" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon orange flower water
content.eamr: ( ing-9 "1 tablespoon orange flower water" )

content.text: 4 cups raw almonds
content.eamr: ( ing-10 "4 cups raw almonds" )

content.text: 1 cup sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-11 "1 cup sugar" )

content.text: 3 eggs
content.eamr: ( ing-12 "3 eggs" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
content.eamr: ( ing-13 "1/2 teaspoon baking powder" )

content.text: 1 teaspoon vanilla powder
content.eamr: ( ing-14 "1 teaspoon vanilla powder" )

content.text: 1 lemon, zested
content.eamr: ( ing-15 "1 lemon, zested" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons orange flower water
content.eamr: ( ing-16 "2 tablespoons orange flower water" )

content.text: cornstarch, for rolling out the dough
content.eamr: ( ing-17 "cornstarch, for rolling out the dough" )

content.text: pine nuts, for decoration
content.eamr: ( ing-18 "pine nuts, for decoration" )

content.text: Bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
content.eamr: ( ing-19 "Bring 6 cups of water to a boil." )

content.text: 0) Bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
1) Remove from heat, and add the almonds.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "Remove"@3:9 / AC
		:source ( "heat"@15:19 / OTHER )
		:ppt ( boiled-water / FOOD )
		:_result ( water-away-heat )
	)
	:inform ( ac-1-1 "add"@25:28 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-10 "the almonds"@29:40 / FOOD )
		:gol ( water-away-heat / FOOD )
		:_result ( almonds-in-water )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "soak"@19:23 / AC
		:ppt ( almonds-in-water "the almonds"@7:18 / FOOD )
		:loc ( water-away-heat "water"@27:32 / FOOD )
		:duration ( dur-2-0 "5 minutes"@43:52 / DUR )
		:_result ( soaked-almonds )
	)
	:inform ( ac-2-1 "drain"@59:64 / AC
		:ppt ( soaked-almonds / FOOD )
		:_result ( drained-almonds )
	)
	:inform ( ac-2-2 "peel"@69:73 / AC
		:ppt ( drained-almonds / FOOD )
		:_result ( peeled-almonds )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Spread"@3:9 / AC
		:ppt ( peeled-almonds "the almonds"@10:21 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-3-0 "baking sheets"@25:38 / TOOL )
		:_result ( almonds-on-sheets )
	)
	:inform ( ac-3-1 "bake"@44:48 / AC
		:heat ( temp-3-0 "200 degrees F(95 degrees C)"@52:79 / TEMPERATURE )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until completely dry and toasted"@80:112 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( almonds-on-sheets / FOOD )
		:_result ( dry-almonds )
	)
)

content.text: 4) This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead.
5) Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "burn"@-1:-1 / AC
		:ppt ( dry-almonds "the nuts"@26:34 / FOOD )
		:polarity ( negative )
		:_result ( not-burned-almonds )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "Combine"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "1 cup sugar"@11:22 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "1 cup water"@27:38 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-6-0 "a saucepan"@42:52 / TOOL )
		:_result ( water-in-pan )
	)
	:inform ( ac-6-1 "boil"@69:73 / AC
		:ppt ( water-in-pan / FOOD )
		:_result ( second-boiled-water )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "Add"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-2 "1 teaspoon lemon juice"@7:29 / FOOD )
		:gol ( water-in-pan / FOOD )
		:_result ( lemon-juice-water )
	)
	:inform ( ac-7-1 "reduce"@31:37 / AC
		:ppt ( "heat"@38:42 / OTHER )
		:gol ( temp-7-0 "low"@46:49 / TEMPERATURE )
		:_result ( low-heat )
	)
	:inform ( ac-7-2 "simmer"@62:68 / AC
		:ppt ( lemon-juice-water "it"@59:61 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-7-0 "until syrupy"@69:81 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:duration ( dur-7-0 "30 to 40 minutes"@89:105 / DUR )
		:_result ( syrupy-lemon-juice )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
   :inform ( ac-8-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
      :ppt ( ing-3 "orange blossom water"@11:31 / FOOD )
      :gol ( syrupy-lemon-juice / FOOD )
	:_result lemon-flower-water
   )
   :inform ( ac-8-1 "remove"@37:43 / AC
      :source ( "heat"@49:53 / OTHER )
      :ppt ( lemon-flower-water / FOOD )
	:_result lemon-flower-away-heat
   )
)

content.text: 9) Set sugar syrup aside.
10) Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl.
content.eamr:
( inst-10 / R
	:inform ( ac-10-0 "Combine"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-4 "flour"@12:17 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "salt"@22:26 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-10-0 "a large mixing bowl"@30:49 / TOOL )
		:_result ( flour-and-salt )
	)
)

content.text: 11) Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "Make"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "a hole"@9:15 / OTHER )
		:loc ( "the center"@19:29 / FOOD )
		:_result ( a-hole-in-flour )
	)
	:inform ( ac-11-1 "pour"@35:39 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-5 "oil"@40:43 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-6 "egg"@45:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "1/2 teaspoon lemon juice"@50:74 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "1 tablespoon orange blossom water"@80:113 / FOOD )
		:gol ( a-hole-in-flour "the center"@119:129 / FOOD )
		:_result ( egg-dough )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs.
content.eamr:
( inst-12 / R
	:inform ( ac-12-0 "Mix"@4:7 / AC
		:until ( cond-12-0 "until the dough resembles coarse crumbs"@21:60 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:instrument ( tool-12-0 "fingers"@13:20 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( egg-dough / FOOD )
		:_result ( coarse-dough )
	)
)

content.text: 13) Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable.
content.eamr:
( inst-13 / R
	:inform ( ac-13-0 "sprinkle"@14:22 / AC
		:simultaneous ( ac-13-1 "mixing"@-1:-1 / AC )
		:gol ( coarse-dough / FOOD )
		:ppt ( "warm water"@28:38 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-13-0 "until the dough becomes soft and pliable"@52:92 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( soft-dough )
	)
)

content.text: 14) Divide into 4 equal portions.
content.eamr:
( inst-14 / R
	:inform ( ac-14-0 "Divide"@4:10 / AC
		:reshape ( "4 equal portions"@16:32 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( soft-dough / FOOD )
		:_result ( 4-portions )
	)
)

content.text: 15) Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside.
content.eamr:
( inst-15 / R
	:inform ( ac-15-0 "Cover"@4:9 / AC
		:ppt ( 4-portions "dough"@10:15 / FOOD )
		:instrument ( tool-15-0 "a wet cloth"@21:32 / TOOL )
		:_result ( covered-dough )
	)
	:inform ( ac-15-1 "set aside"@38:47 / AC
		:ppt ( covered-dough / FOOD )
		:_result ( dough-aside )
	)
)

content.text: 16) In a food processor, finely grind the almonds.
content.eamr:
( inst-16 / R
	:inform ( ac-16-0 "grind"@32:37 / AC
		:loc ( tool-16-0 "a food processor"@7:23 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( not-burned-almonds "the almonds"@38:49 / FOOD )
		:_result ( ground-almonds )
	)
)

content.text: 17) Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water.
content.eamr:
( inst-17 / R
	:inform ( ac-17-0 "Measure"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( ground-almonds "3 cups of the finely ground almonds"@12:47 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-17-0 "a mixing bowl"@53:66 / TOOL )
		:_result ( almonds-in-bowl )
	)
	:inform ( ac-17-1 "stir"@72:76 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-11 "1 cup sugar"@91:102 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-13 "baking powder"@104:117 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-14 "vanilla powder"@119:133 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-15 "lemon zest"@135:145 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-16 "2 tablespoons orange flower water"@151:184 / FOOD )
		:gol ( almonds-in-bowl / FOOD )
		:_result ( almond-mixture )
	)
)

content.text: 18) Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture.
content.eamr:
( inst-18 / R
	:inform ( ac-18-0 "Mix in"@4:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-12 "three eggs"@11:21 / FOOD )
		:simultaneous ( ac-18-1 "stirring"@-1:-1 / AC )
		:gol ( almond-mixture / FOOD )
		:_result ( almond-egg-mixture )
	)
	:inform ( ac-18-2 "mix"@58:61 / AC
		:until ( cond-18-0 "until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture"@62:104 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( almond-egg-mixture / FOOD )
		:_result ( almond-filling )
	)
)

content.text: 19) Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking.
content.eamr:
( inst-19 / R
   :inform ( ac-19-0 "Sprinkle"@4:12 / AC
      :ppt ( ing-17 "cornstarch"@13:23 / FOOD )
      :gol ( "the rolling surface"@27:46 / FOOD )
      :prp ( "to prevent sticking"@47:66 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	:_result cornstarch-on-surface
   )
)

content.text: 20) Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch).
content.eamr:
( inst-20 / R
	:inform ( ac-20-0 "Roll"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( dough-aside "each portion of dough"@9:30 / FOOD )
		:mnr ( "1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch)"@-1:-1 / OTHER )
		:_result ( rolled-dough )
	)
)

content.text: 21) Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each.
content.eamr:
( inst-21 / R
	:inform ( ac-21-0 "Cut"@4:7 / AC
		:ppt ( rolled-dough "the rolled dough"@8:24 / FOOD )
		:reshape ( "circles"@30:37 / FOOD )
		:mnr ( "10 centimeters (4 inches)"@47:61 / OTHER )
		:_result ( dough-circles )
	)
)

content.text: 22) Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking.
content.eamr:
( inst-22 / R
	:inform ( ac-22-0 "wipe"@12:16 / AC
		:gol ( dough-circles "the surface of each circle"@17:43 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-17 "cornstarch"@49:59 / FOOD )
		:_result ( wiped-dough )
	)
	:inform ( ac-22-1 "fit"@65:68 / AC
		:gol ( tool-22-0 "a tart mold"@74:85 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( wiped-dough / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-22-0 "to prevent sticking"@108:127 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:mnr ( "cornstarch side"@87:102 / OTHER )
		:_result ( dough-in-mold )
	)
)

content.text: 23) Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim.
content.eamr:
( inst-23 / R
	:inform ( ac-23-0 "press"@11:16 / AC
		:ppt ( dough-in-mold "the dough"@17:26 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-23-0 "the sides and bottom of the mold"@32:64 / TOOL )
		:_result ( pressed-dough )
	)
	:inform ( ac-23-1 "trim"@70:74 / AC
		:ppt ( "extra dough"@75:86 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-23-1 "the rim"@99:106 / TOOL )
		:_result ( trimmed-dough )
	)
)

content.text: 24) Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling.
25) Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm.
content.eamr:
( inst-25 / R
	:inform ( ac-25-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:loc ( tool-25-0 "the top shelf"@12:25 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-25-0 "350 degrees F"@29:42 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-25-1 "175 degrees C"@44:57 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-25-0 "20 to 25 minutes"@63:79 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-25-0 "until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm"@84:145 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( filled-tart / FOOD )
		:_result ( baked-tart )
	)
)

content.text: 26) Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven.
content.eamr:
( inst-26 / R
	:inform ( ac-26-0 "Remove"@4:10 / AC
		:ppt ( baked-tart "the tarts"@11:20 / FOOD )
		:source ( tool-26-0 "the molds"@26:35 / TOOL )
		:when ( cond-26-0 "as soon as they come out of the oven"@36:72 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( tart-outside-mold )
	)
)

content.text: 27) Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot.
content.eamr:
( inst-27 / R
	:inform ( ac-27-0 "Dip"@4:7 / AC
		:ppt ( tart-outside-mold "each tart"@8:17 / FOOD )
		:gol ( set-aside-sugar-syrup "the sugar syrup"@21:36 / FOOD )
		:while ( cond-27-0 "while still hot"@37:52 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( tart-with-syrup )
	)
)

content.text: 28) Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration.
content.eamr:
( inst-28 / R
	:inform ( ac-28-0 "Stick"@4:9 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-18 "a pine nut"@10:20 / FOOD )
		:gol ( tart-with-syrup "the middle of each tart"@26:49 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-28-0 "for decoration"@50:64 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( tart-with-nut )
	)
)

content.text: 29) Place on a wire rack to drain.
content.eamr:
( inst-29 / R
	:inform ( ac-29-0 "Place"@4:9 / AC
		:gol ( tool-29-0 "a wire rack"@13:24 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( tart-with-nut / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-29-0 "to drain"@25:33 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:_result ( FINAL_PRODUCT )
	)
)
